Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2008 02:32PM kissta wrote: I found the lump myself in Oct. I went to my regular Doctor then had a mam & us. The next visit was to my surgeon. He opened my file to show me the report, it showed birad level 5, (I think thats what it was called) I ask him what the highest level was, he then said 6. So I knew it was highly probable I had bc. His Nurse (Brenda) was great, she stayed late and answered many questions for me and even gave me the talk about how far medical tech. has come in the area of bc. I am very please with the level of care I have received so far. Krista
Posts.Title: How were you told basil16883 AnnNYC

Posts.Content: kissta wrote: Hi Everyone,  I would like to get some feed back from others who have or had IV Ports. I will be starting Chemo treatments in Feb and have requested one. I'm not one who likes to be poked on and can be quite the weenie about getting an IV. So I thought a port would be a good thing for me. I also know that I didn't care much for my drain either. So how are they to care for? Do they make things sore in the area? Any special concerns with bathing? Thanks a bunch, Krista God has a greater plan for us in the future then we have ever seen or dreamed of in the past. Dx 12/11/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 1, 2/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I.V Port kissta Cathy-CA

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2008 01:46PM kissta wrote: Thank you all for responding. My Mom had a port while going through her treatments but she was not one to give much input, good or bad. When they told me they needed to go back in to remove more tissue from my breast, I thought it would good since I'm out anyway, to have my port put in at the same time. Again Thanks, Krista
Posts.Title: I.V Port kissta Cathy-CA

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2008 01:49PM kissta wrote: Hello Barbara, Well it's been a while since you posted this blog. Just asking how you are at the point in your journey? I myself have been very calm, I know that God is in control. I moved over 600 miles from friends and family 2 1/2 years ago. So even the Doctors have all been new to me.  I feel a peace about all the medical personal I have been involved with thus far. I know God has placed me in good hands. My biggest concerns come from not knowing what is next. So it is a great help to come here and read all the stories from others who have been down the path before me. I am very grateful that the medical world has come a long way in the area of bc. My G-Ma, 2 Aunts and a cousin have all been here before me and have gone on to live healthy long lives. Krista
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2008 09:11PM kissta wrote: Hey Cookie & Feb Ladies, Sorry I have been offline for a few days. We bought a house and have been moving. Man I am beat! I just don't have any energy, I don't start chemo until the 7th and I need the energy to get stuff done. I bought a cute pink canvas tote bag to carry all my stuff in. The Onc gave me a 3 ring binder that has alot to it. Tabs for the different topics we go over...ie: Medications & side effects, Insurance, Treatment Plan, Health & Nutrition, Beauty Care, and My Progress. A calender to let me know of up coming events in my area about bc. I will also keep a book to read, puzzle book, snacks, chap stick, water bottle, gum, IPod. Anything I think I may need while at the Onc office for treatment. I also got the power port. Not at all what I thought it would be, but it will be alot less to care for. My Mom had to do her own flushes with the port she had, the Onc office will take care of all that for me. I am still sore for having it put in. My lump and snb is on my right side. I still can't stretch out my arm like before. The Surgeon had to cut a nerve to get to the nodes, so I will always be numb in my armpit area. The port is on my left, and now I'm sore on both sides. Another thing the Onc has me on Calcium & Vit D. He said Chemo is hard on your bones. I'm also er+ pr+ so my treatment will hinder the estrogen that other parts of my body need.  Well I'm pooped, I'll chat more later. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 09:30AM - edited Feb 15, 2008 09:31AM by kissta Hanging in There! I can't really figure what was from the chemo or the stomach bug. I went yesterday for a blood draw to check my wbc, count was good. Told them about how I was feeling, vomited 3 times with diarrhea each time while there. So they put me on a IV with anti nausea meds and something for my diarrhea. Talk about getting kicked while your down. I am so ready for some real food, I've lived off crackers, toast, yogurt and gatorade for a week. Here's to better days!! Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2008 07:41PM kissta wrote: Well if I only knew what normal was. I have been dealing with gastroenteritis since Thursday. If I stop taking the amodium, the diarrhea returns, and while taking it, I feel bloated. This sucks!!! I haven't eaten a normal meal in 2 weeks, not that I can taste things very well anyway. I think I need some cheese to go with my wine! Well I hope everyone has a good week, blessings to all, Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2008 01:30PM kissta wrote: Well today is a better day. I'm eating some but not back to were I was. I know I can afford to lose a pound or two anyway. My nose is really sore, anyone having extra drainage? I read that this is normal to have a runny nose from the chemo. I'm grateful for the tissue with the lotion. I still have my hair thank goodness. I have been unable to get out and wig shop. I did finally get 2 ordered today with 2 day delievery. The wonderful woman who ordered them for me told me to pay when they come in. If I didn't like one of them she would return it, no charge. In this day and age it's always pay in advance and a hassle to exchange or return things. So that has made things alot easier for me. I am learning to except help, I can't do it all (even though I have thought that for years) Some day I will be able to return the help. I think Fabulous Febuary Fighters sounds great. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2008 04:19PM - edited Feb 28, 2008 04:21PM by kissta Well thank goodness for laptop computers. I was able to bring mine to tx today. I also found out from the Onc that what I thought was the stomach flu may have been a side effect from the Taxotere and or decadron so he made a few changes in my treatment for today. Shaved my head last week so I'm sporting a new wig. My Daughter was there to watch. I think it helped her to see, she was so worried about me loosing my hair. Kim- I pray that all goes well with you today and you get through your first tx with few or no side effects. Take your meds, rest when you need to rest, even if it means asking those well meaning helpers to visit another day. Aurora- Thank you for all your advice, concerns and warm wishes. God has blessed your Husband with a wonderful woman and his children with a loving & caring Mother. Patricia- Glad to hear you had a great outing with friends, and to be hit on to boot...woohoo!! For the rest of you ladies thank you for your stories. They encourage me, make me laugh, and just bring me hope. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 11:58AM kissta wrote: I guess I must be a wuss. I just seem to have no energy at all. It's all I can do to make it through work. The first week after tx is the hardest for me, my taste buds are shot and I have alot of dry mouth issues. No energy and no apatite. The 2 weeks following are alot better for me. We are still dealing with winter here in Iowa. I so want to be out getting some fresh air and going for a walk. But I am a bit guarded with all the colds & flu that is going around. Don't want anything extra. I'm home today just being a bum and resting. Glad to hear most of you are doing very well. I know at some point things will be better. Have a good weekend!! Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 01:33PM kissta wrote: Good Afternoon Ladies, Still having a good week. Doc says to keep an eye on the port, if it flares up again, it will have to come out. Other then that all is well. Rose- For me losing my hair was no big deal. It effects each one of us differently. Hair loss is one of the outward signs that we are dealing with cancer, and it causes others to look at us like we're pitiful at times. So keep your chin up, cause we're kicking cancer's butt. I just received a t-shirt from a co-worker that stated: Fighting Like a Girl, in pink letters with pink boxing gloves and the pink bc ribbon. I just think it's the bomb. Blessings to you all, Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2008 02:44PM kissta wrote: Afternoon Ladies, Well it's Sunday and I am feeling alot better. I worked this past week and made it through the whole week with no problems. I did have a few days of wanting to eat everything I could get my hands on. Things still taste a bit bland, but better. My Daughter's team had a basketball tournament yesterday so I was busy helping with that for several hours. Today I am working on unpacking more boxes. We moved just before my first tx and we still have lots to do. I have my 2nd tx this Thursday. I hope all goes better then the first one. You all have a blessed week, I pray God gives those who need it a peace that will help them through. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2008 01:35PM kissta wrote: Well day 2 after chemo and I'm doing pretty good. I worked a full day at the bank yesterday. I'm just kinda piddling today, picked up a bit around the house and just taking it easy. I don't know if it's the chemo or what, but I went to bed at 7:30 and slept most of the night, and then took a morning nap. I'm just letting my body tell me what it needs, no rushing into anything. Chris- My Onc ajusted my Decadron this go around. Thought it best to wean me off a bit longer. He told me it can cause alot of cramping and diarrhea. Donna- It helped my Daughter a good deal to come with me. She came on her own. I went to the salon after work, she just walked over when she seen me there. She was worried about seeing me with no hair, now it's no big deal to her. I do wear a cap at times around the house, but when my head it tender I take it off. She doesn't care. She even told me that she was no longer worried about me, she knows I'm a strong woman and that I will beat this. Patricia- Praise God for good days!! And here's to many good days for us all!! Kim- Glad to hear 1st tx went well and you had a good day with your hubby. It's such a comfort to be pleased with your Onc and the staff. I'm glad you found one who is caring for you the way you should be treated. It makes a world of difference. I know God has placed me in very good hands with my Onc and his staff. Aurora- Glad to hear the head aches are better and you got a good nights rest. Blessing to you all, Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 10:26PM - edited Jan 30, 2008 10:33PM by kissta (((((Hugs))))) to you Karen, keep saying, this too shall pass. God will never take you where his strength & grace will not help you. I had my port put in yesterday, I'm a weenie when it comes to getting IV's and blood draws. I know my Mom was glad to have hers while going through treatment for lung cancer 7 years ago. The treatments can be very hard on your veins. I have heard of some starting treatment with out a port then getting one because of how it effected their veins. I start chemo on the 7th, I'm very grateful I only have to have 6 treatments. I do think about the hair loss myself, but try to stay positive. I will probably save 20 minutes getting ready for work. I think about my eyebrows, I don't know how to draw them in....lol I try to take a day at a time, it's overwhelming to think of it all at once. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 04:53PM kissta wrote: Having a good day....wahoooo!! I am feeling so much better, I wish I could feel like this all the time. Day 5,6 & 7 are hard on me. I just have no energy at all and prefer to be in bed for 2 days. I am taking the full treatment of TAC, I have 4 more treatments to go, then radiation to follow. I see the Surgeon tomorrow about my port. I am currently on antibiotics, the port may be infected and need to come out, not sure at this point, I'll see what he says then. It is sore in the area and a bit lumpier then before. As for me I am 43, I'm from Oklahoma but now live in Iowa. Married for almost 4 years and have 2 kids 17 & 12. My son lives in Ok with his Dad and my dd here with me. She is a busy kid and keeps me hopping. I work for a bank and enjoy what I do. We have 4 dogs, 2 cats a bird and fish. My brother called me Ellie Mae as a kid. I have a wig I wear to work, but I'm natural at home. The itching is no fun. I am on a second wave of hair loss at this point. I had my head buzzed about 10 days after the first tx and now my fuzzies are shedding. I think they could be the source of the itch, guess we'll see. Well heres to a good week for everyone. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2008 02:10PM kissta wrote: Hello Ladies,  I hope everyone had a good Easter weekend and that spring is in the air where you live. It's popping it's head out now and then here in Iowa.  Tx 3 was on Thursday, I had a off weekend with vomiting and sleeping. Had to make a trip to the ER for fluids and meds that worked for the side effects. I'm doing better today just kinda taking it easy at home.  You all have a good week. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2008 04:56PM kissta wrote: Hello Ladies, I had my first treatment on Thursday. I must say it was a long day, had my labs done at 1:00, short visit with the Onc, then stated my treatment. I left the Onc off about 5:45. I did fine and drove myself home. Not much of a appetite so I had a small dinner then went to bed. Woke about 2:30 felling a bit nauseous, took one of they meds they gave me and went back to sleep. Had to be back to the Onc office for the Neulasta shot around 8:00 am, then off to work. I took the meds for nausea like they said, but the one sure made me feel tired and I went home at 1:30. I laid down for a nap around 4:00 and woke at 9:00. It's Saturday and I'm just taking it easy. I'm not feeling to bad, just a bit tired and a mild head ache, but good. I hope you are all doing well. Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2008 09:38AM kissta wrote: Good Morning Ladies, Well I'm home resting again today. Had my tx on Thursday, went to work 4 hours on Friday and 2 hours on Monday. I just don't seem to have any energy. My stomach is not in the best shape these days. I went from taking no meds of any kind, to many kinds. I take Calcium & Vit D, I'm on something because I am prone to cold sores & fever blisters. Tagamint for reflux and several anti nausea meds. I took the last round of nausea meds for this tx cycle yesterday. I do have one that is for as needed. Everything I eat taste bland and I get gassy and that in turn causes my stomach to bother me. I need some input on stool softners. How often and how long? My Onc is using the TAC tx plan for me, he said they can be very hard on your system all at once. But his plan is for the cure and I want that also. I'm glad I have your stories to read and help me. I hope at some point when I'm done whining, I will be of help to others. Thank you, Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2008 04:54PM kissta wrote: Looks like I will be starting in mid Feb sometime. I have to go back in for surgery on the 29th to remove more breast tissue, the margins were to close for the Onc. I will also be getting a IV Port at the same time. I am grateful I only have to do 6 treatments every 21 days. I am in the process of getting together a nice little goodie bag for those trips. I have gotten a lot of input from others about good things to have on hand. There is so much to keep up with, and I'm glad I've heard from others who have been through all this. I'm there with you, Krista
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 10:12AM kissta wrote: Hi Cookie,  I am reading a book called Any Day with Hair is a Good Hair Day. This book gives you some ideas of what to have on hand while getting your treatments. Things like crossword puzzle book, tissue, hard candy, quarters for vending machines, a journal book, IPod (or something similar) My Onc office gave me a 3 ring binder w/dividers, Getting Started, Chemo Drugs & effects, Insurance, Appts, Beauty Care, My Dx & Treatment plan and My Progress. You should keep all gas receipts, mileage, everything you buy thats out of pocket. All Medical charges not covered by Ins. are tax deductible. I have heard about the Ice or popcicle during treatment, I believe it's used while receiving Adriamycin, which will also turn your pee red for a few days. Wow!! Thanks for your input, Krista
